---
title: "Directed Acyclic Graphs"
---


::: callout-note
You can delete everything in here and start fresh.
:::
1-

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_04df741874faf581c8dabe786d6f1e0a'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dagitty)
library(ggdag)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'ggdag'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> The following object is masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
collider <- dagify(
  P ~ S_AB ,
  P ~ S_CD,
  coords = list(x = c(S_CD = 3, P = 2, S_AB = 1),
                y = c(S_CD = 1, P = 0, S_AB = 1))
)

# Plot DAG
ggdag(collider) 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_638324df8fb96cf2ba7b47ad3e0a9a4b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
customer_sat <- readRDS("D:/TU Hamburg/Semester_5/Causal Data Science for Business Analytics/Causal_Data_Science_Data/Causal_Data_Science_Data/customer_sat.rds")
View(customer_sat)
```
:::


2.1

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_f504f31727c8826d01dd25c10a11a06c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
lm_customers <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = customer_sat)
summary(lm_customers)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = customer_sat)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
#> -12.412  -5.257   1.733   4.506  12.588 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)  78.8860     4.2717  18.467 1.04e-10 ***
#> follow_ups   -3.3093     0.6618  -5.001 0.000243 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 7.923 on 13 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.658,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.6316 
#> F-statistic: 25.01 on 1 and 13 DF,  p-value: 0.0002427
```
:::
:::



2.2:

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_516db2bd855a316fbb2961a454b17a2e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
lm_customers_account_for_subscription <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = customer_sat)
summary(lm_customers_account_for_subscription)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = customer_sat)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
#> -4.3222 -2.1972  0.3167  2.2667  3.9944 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                      Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)           26.7667     6.6804   4.007  0.00206 ** 
#> follow_ups             2.1944     0.7795   2.815  0.01682 *  
#> subscriptionPremium   44.7222     5.6213   7.956 6.88e-06 ***
#> subscriptionPremium+  18.0722     2.1659   8.344 4.37e-06 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 2.958 on 11 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.9597,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.9487 
#> F-statistic: 87.21 on 3 and 11 DF,  p-value: 5.956e-08
```
:::
:::

3- It seems that the follow_ups with account to subscription has higher correlation with satisfaction, compared with follow_ups only according the adjusted R-squared value. Furthermore, the P-value of the regression between the satisfaction and the follow_ups with account to subscription is lower. Additionally, the Estimate value changed from -3.3093 to 2.1944, which change totally the relation from decreasing to increasing.


4-

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_54fad5b7b85193d0c869cb56b9160460'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)

customers_ncond <- ggplot(customer_sat, aes(x = satisfaction , y = follow_ups)) +
geom_point() +
stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F)

# Conditioning on student  
customers_cond <- ggplot(customer_sat, aes(x = satisfaction, y = follow_ups,
                            color = subscription, 
                            alpha = subscription)) +
  geom_point() +
  stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F) +
  scale_alpha_manual(values = c("subscription" = 1, "no_subscription" = 0.2)) +
  theme(legend.position = "right")

# Plot both
customers_ncond
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
customers_cond
```
